name: Children's Hospital
address: 4800 Sand Point Way NE; Seattle, WA 98105
description: Extensive services for children. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. Referral from a primary care provider is required for non-urgent services. Urgent care (less expensive than an emergency room visit) does not require a referral or appointment. Available at Childrenâ€™s Hospital clinics in Seattle, Bellevue, and Mill Creek. Urgent care hours only: Monday through Friday: 5 pm to 10:30 pm; Saturday, Sunday and holidays: 11 am to 8 pm.

name: University of Washington Medical Center
lat: The University of Washington has a network of neighborhood clinics, but insurance is required.

name: Harborview Madison Clinic

address.Physical: Harborview Medical Center - 2nd Floor, West Clinic; 325 Ninth Avenue, Seattle
address.Mail: Harborview Medical Center; Box 359930; 325 Ninth Ave. Seattle, WA 98104

description: Medical care and social services for persons living with HIV/AIDS regardless of sexual orientation, race, or ability to pay. New patients: call 206-744-5155 to schedule first appointment. Routine appointments: 206-520-5000. Established patients may be seen on an urgent walk-in basis by calling the clinic and speaking with a triage nurse.

name: Urban Rest Stop
description: Besides the showers, laundry facilities, and hygiene supplies for which they are generally known, Urban Rest Stop also has a Health Room offering free health care. Services: emergency first aid, preventative health care, prenatal care, referrals to other community health services. On the fourth Monday of every month, foot care is also available. Health Room: Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 8:30 am to 11:30 pm.

name: Odessa Brown Children's Clinic (operated by Children's Hospital)
address: 2101 E. Yesler Way Suite 100; Seattle, WA 98122
description: Outpatient medical, dental, and Mental Health services for youth (newborn to 18 years). Medical coupons and insurance accepted. WIC provider. No child will be refused services.

name: Cedar River Clinics
address: 4300 Talbot Road South, Suite 403; Renton, WA 98055
description: Pregnancy testing, pregnancy options counseling, all methods of birth control (Take Charge provider), STD and HIV testing and counseling, first and second trimester abortion. Teens welcome. Medical interpreters arranged for limited English clients. Payment options for abortion include insurance, Alaska Medicaid, Oregon Health Plan, WA DSHS Medical Coupons. Phones are answered Monday to Friday 8:00 am to 5:00pm and Saturday 9:00 am to 2:00 pm. Also operates similar clinics in Tacoma and Yakima.

name: Country Doctor Free Teen Clinic
description: No appointments: drop-in medical services only. Serves homeless youth ages 12-23. No money, no insurance, no coupons necessary. No cost for medicine or lab work. STD, anonymous HIV testing, pregnancy tests, general physicals, and sick care. Licensed Acupuncturist, and Licensed Massage Therapist available Tuesdays only. Monday & Tuesday only, 6:00 p.m - 9:00 p.m. at Country Doctor Clinic, 500 19th Ave. E.

name: Seattle Indian Health Board
description: Health services (including dental, in- and out-patient alcohol/drug counseling) targeting Native Americans but available to all. WIC provider. Sliding scale fee and medical coupons. Mon-Fri 8:30 a.m - 6:00 p.m.; Sat 9:00 a.m - 2:00 p.m. (limited services); Sun CLOSED
